questions.question: What is the class that gives properties to another class?
questions.explanation: The parent class provides features to derived classes.

questions.question: What is the class that receives properties from another class?
questions.explanation: The child class inherits features from the parent class.

questions.question: What Java keyword establishes inheritance?
questions.explanation: The extends keyword creates inheritance relationships.

questions.question: What Python function calls parent class methods?
questions.explanation: Super() accesses methods from the parent class.

questions.question: What relationship does inheritance represent?
questions.explanation: Inheritance models an is-a relationship between classes.

questions.question: What type of inheritance has one parent and one child?
questions.explanation: Single inheritance involves direct parent-child relationship.

questions.question: What type of inheritance has multiple levels?
questions.explanation: Multilevel inheritance creates a chain of inheritance.

questions.question: What benefit does inheritance provide?
questions.explanation: Inheritance allows sharing code across related classes.

questions.question: What can child classes add to inherited features?
questions.explanation: Child classes extend parent functionality with new members.

questions.question: What C++ symbol indicates inheritance?
questions.explanation: C++ uses a colon to specify base class in inheritance.
